text:
We have Jsp,Java Bean,Java servlet, HTML pages in this Application. The site in 
running in windows environment and DB2 database which is connecting to AS400 
system thru T3 line remotely. Now the application is hosted in Windows NT 
Server with IIS 4.0 and Jakarta Tomcat 3.2. Tomcat is running presently as a 
Service in NT. The problem we are facing is the Serivce is automatically 
shutting down.(which is restarting itself bcoz it is set like this). When this 
shuts down for a fews seconds are restarts itself, we are loosing data.When we 
used to start Tomcat mannually thru Command prompt also, this shutdown was 
occuring. 
The questions are 
1) Why does tomcat  shuts down abruptly ??
2) We have included Connection pooling (in Connection Bean)
   is it bcoz of this ???  
3) Is it bcoz of AS400/DB2 database connecting remotely thru T3 line ???

Thanks in Advance 
Regards,
Harish

text:
Tomcat 3 is no longer the focus of development.

It is almost certain there will be no development work on versions prior to 3.3.x and it is highly unlikely that further development will take place on 3.3.x

All open Tomcat 3 bugs are therefore being closed as WONTFIX.

If any of these issues is still a problem for you, please test the latest stable release of a supported version (http://wiki.apache.org/tomcat/TomcatVersions). If you still have the issue with the latest stable release of a supported version, please re-open this bug and change the version to the one you tested.
